tn.ref: imposed a tax on the land and on the coastlands along the sea
tn.text: To impose a tax means to make people may a tax. The land and coastlands represent the people living there. AT: "made the people living in the land and on the coastlands along the sea pay a tax" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The abstract noun achievements" can be expressed with the verb "achieve" or the phrase "do great things. AT: "All that he achieved" or "all the great things that he did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the full account of the greatness of Mordecai to which the king had raised him
tn.text: Raising someone to greatness represents making someone great. AT: "the full account of how the King had made Mordecai great" or "the full account of how great Mordecai was because the king had made him great" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]

tn.ref: second in rank to King Ahasuerus
tn.text: "the most important person after King Ahasuerus"
The word brothers represents people who were like him. AT: "fellow Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he sought the welfare of his people
tn.text: Seeking something is a metaphor for working hard for something. The abstract noun "welfare" can be translated a phrase with the verb "prosper" or the adjective "secure"  AT: "He worked hard for his people to prosper" or "he worked hard for his people to be secure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: he spoke for the peace of all his people
tn.text: "he represented the people so that they might have peace"
